intro: Austroeupatorium candidum, commonly known as white boneset, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Austroeupatorium candidum is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
